history.content: You won't get priority until *after* you're declared. I would recommend phase 1ing those classes unless you have other more important classes. Normally, 170 and 188 are okay to phase 2, but it seems that this semester there are more enrollment problems, and you'll probably just feel better if you know that you are enrolled or high on the waitlist.

children.subject:
In contrary to Anonymous Atom, the EECS depatrment announced (and also Chancellor Carol Christ on her Reddit AMA) that they got their budget balanced and enrollment space should be fine.
So even though you (and I too) are going to get placed on the waitlist for those classes until the adjustment period begins and opens enrollment to people besides declared CS and EECS, I personally think we should be fine to Phase 2 these classes. If one of these is extra important to you, though, you should consider phase 1ing to get a better spot on the waitlist.

history.content: If I am going to be declared after this semester, how will it work if I am trying to enroll in CS170 and CS188. Should I phase 1 or phase 2 these classes?
history.subject: WIll be declared after this semester
